text: Frank J. Corr (January 12, 1877 - June 3, 1934) was an American politician. He was the acting mayor of Chicago, Illinois in 1933 after the assassination of Anton Cermak. Corr was a Democrat. Corr was born on January 12, 1877 in Brooklyn, New York. His family moved to Chicago in 1890. Corr was married to Mary Corr. They had no children. Corr died on June 3, 1934 in Chicago, Illinois from a heart attack, aged 57. ==References== Category:1877 births Category:1934 deaths Category:Deaths from myocardial infarction Category:Mayors of Chicago Category:Politicians from New York City Category:Democratic Party (United States) politicians
title: Frank J. Corr
